I have an interesting issue. I ran into a bug with another mod that caused my starting Kerbals to be reset (I can't reproduce that bug, sorry) and as such, after recovering my kerbals they don't have any ribbons or missions completed. Is there any way to recover that data or am I going to have to assign them ribbons manually?

If you mean in FF format, then check the halloffame.ksp.# files -- those are backups of the main halloffame.ksp.

You can also recover at least the times of various "first" achievements by looking in your save file. Search for "ProgressTracking".

Updated buglist here

Sorry guys for absence. I'm a teacher and I've been working on reports and also looking for ways to say certain things and superlatives that exceed superlatives.

So... I'm back... sorry for not answering for a while but time was limited the last weeks and there is a live beyond KSP. I decided not to read in this thread, because if I do and got bug reports I WILL investigate them and that would cause a lot of trouble.

I will provide another download link this weekend. An updated version with some fixes will come a few days later.
He's back...

G'day All.

I had a word with Nereid the other day. He said that he's been a bit busy with work. He is keen to get back into it, and he will as soon as he can.

At the moment I'd like to get a list of all the bugs that I can keep in one place for him. I'll try to keep this updated too. As far as I've been able to read, these are the major bugs and the circumstances in which they occur:

Bugs

1) Pressing the F key is bringing up the Final Frontier screen. Should be Alt-F (?). Possible conflict with Toolbar? Happens in flight and in EVA.

2) Ribbons appear as black ribbons. Possible conflict with Active Texture Reduction?

3) Scrolling through awarded ribbons log only goes for a couple of lines.

4) Kerbals getting the 6 G's ribbon when they go on EVA (details in http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67246?p=1044318#post1044318). Not 100% reproducible yet, but it seems to be easy to trigger.

5) The Certified Badass ribbon cannot be assigned from in-game, nor is it displayed if you force it by editing the hall of fame file. The bug seems to be specific to this one ribbon.

6) "accumulated mission time" is given in earth units, needs to be given in Kerbin units.

First thanks to SmarterThanMe for keeping track of the bug reports. That saves a lot of work for me.

1) ALT-F-Problem: Well, maybe my solution for detecting keys in KSP isn't the best one. ALT-F can be disabled in the prefs of FF as a workaround. Because this is a nasty bug, it gets top priority.

4) I know this; happened for me too. Could be very hard to fix.

6) Best solution seems to be an option, so that anybody can choose between earth and kerbal units.

Before I can work on any bugs I will have to upgrade to the latest version of KSP. Let's hope SQUAD didn't change to much...

Edited June 11, 2014 by Nereid

Welcome back!

6) Best solution seems to be an option, so that anybody can choose between earth and kerbal units.

Given that this is already controlled by a game option (KERBIN_TIME = True in settings.cfg), can't you just read that option instead of adding another?

Welcome back!

Given that this is already controlled by a game option (KERBIN_TIME = True in settings.cfg), can't you just read that option instead of adding another?

Of course. Didn't know that.
